channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. tightens immigration after National Guard shooting. And, latest on Ukraine talks
item.description: The White House is moving swiftly to tighten legal immigration reviews after two National Guard members were shot last week. And, Ukraine enters a new round of negotiations to end the war with Russia.
item.content:encoded:
The White House is moving swiftly to tighten legal immigration reviews after two National Guard members were shot last week. And, Ukraine enters a new round of negotiations to end the war with Russia.

(Image credit: Andrew Leyde)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Pope Leo visits a wounded Lebanon in his first trip to the Middle East
item.description: Pope Leo XIV is on his first visit to Lebanon. He arrives at a pivotal time for the country, buffeted by conflict with Israel and a devastating economic crisis.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Leo XIV is on his first visit to Lebanon. He arrives at a pivotal time for the country, buffeted by conflict with Israel and a devastating economic crisis.

(Image credit: Domenico Stinellis)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: The agriculture secretary says SNAP changes are coming. Here's what we know
item.description: Brooke Rollins has made a case for sweeping changes to food aid programs by claiming USDA has uncovered "massive fraud." But she and USDA haven't provided the underlying data or any evidence.
item.content:encoded:
Brooke Rollins has made a case for sweeping changes to food aid programs by claiming USDA has uncovered "massive fraud." But she and USDA haven't provided the underlying data or any evidence.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: Supreme Court weighs copyright fight between music industry and internet providers
item.description: At issue is whether internet providers can be liable for their users' committing copyright violations using its services.
item.content:encoded:
At issue is whether internet providers can be liable for their users' committing copyright violations using its services.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Alyssa Kapasi

item.title: During Advent, immigrant congregations find hope shadowed by fear
item.description: The weeks leading up to Christmas are typically a time of anticipation and preparation for Christians, but for some immigrant congregations the mood this Advent season isn't especially hopeful.
item.content:encoded:
The weeks leading up to Christmas are typically a time of anticipation and preparation for Christians, but for some immigrant congregations the mood this Advent season isn't especially hopeful.

(Image credit: Sean Gallup)
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: From ChatGPT to strength training: Here's how 100-year-olds are thriving
item.description: A new survey of centenarians finds a growing number of people living to 100 have prioritized healthy habits. Here's how exercise, social connection and positivity play a role in aging well.
item.content:encoded:
A new survey of centenarians finds a growing number of people living to 100 have prioritized healthy habits. Here's how exercise, social connection and positivity play a role in aging well.

(Image credit: alvarez)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: An independent effort says AI is the secret to topple 2-party power in Congress
item.description: Using artificial intelligence to identify congressional districts where independent candidates could win, an organization called the Independent Center is aiming to disrupt the two-party system.
item.content:encoded:
Using artificial intelligence to identify congressional districts where independent candidates could win, an organization called the Independent Center is aiming to disrupt the two-party system.

(Image credit: Glenn Harvey for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Thousands in Philippines protest corruption, demand return of stolen funds
item.description: Thousands of demonstrators including from the dominant Roman Catholic church clergy are protesting in the Philippines, calling for the swift prosecution of top legislators.
item.content:encoded:
Thousands of demonstrators including from the dominant Roman Catholic church clergy are protesting in the Philippines, calling for the swift prosecution of top legislators.

(Image credit: Aaron Favila)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Lost for over 400 years, Rubens painting sells for $2.7 million at auction
item.description: An auctioneer stumbled upon the long lost painting, which depicts the crucifixion of Jesus Christ, inside a Paris townhouse last year during a routine visit.
item.content:encoded:
An auctioneer stumbled upon the long lost painting, which depicts the crucifixion of Jesus Christ, inside a Paris townhouse last year during a routine visit.

(Image credit: Michel Euler)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Michael Jordan's fight against NASCAR heads to court
item.description: Michael Jordan's 23XI Racing and Front Row Motorsports are taking NASCAR to federal court Monday over antitrust allegations.
item.content:encoded:
Michael Jordan's 23XI Racing and Front Row Motorsports are taking NASCAR to federal court Monday over antitrust allegations.

(Image credit: Butch Dill)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
